The general Conditions of Carriage of Goods are applicable to both internal and ‘‘international” carriage as hereinafter mentioned and can be inspected at the Booking Offices of British Overseas Airways Corporation and its Associated and Subsidiary Companies and the Airports to and from which their regular services operate. COMBINED TRANSPORT. The general Conditions of Air-Rail Transport of goods are applicable to combined transport (air-rail). ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS. International Carriage, as defined by Article I paragraphs 2 and 3 of the Convention of Warsaw of 12th October 1929, is subject to the rules relating to liability established by the said Convention, upon which the aforesaid General Conditions are based. In no case are goods accepted for carriage with a special declaration of value at delivery. The insertion of the value of goods, for any purpose, in any part of this document or of the Consignment Note(s) shall not constitute a special declaration of value at delivery. The right to substitute alternative carriers is reserved. I have the honour to inform you that the expenditure under the heads nested below up to December, 1945 has exceeded the sanctioned appropriation for the current year, and to request that you let me know, on an early date, what steps you have taken to obtain an additional appropriation to ccfer the excess and any further expenditure that may be incurred during the cunrent year(Art.91, S.A.C., Vol.I). If an additional appropriation has been applied for, the number and date of your application should be quoted. External Affairs: Returned to the A.G.C.R., N.Delhi. Additional appropriation was applied for to the Hon’ble the P.R., who has revised the grant under these heads to Rs.19,100/- and 26,500/- respy. 'A 4-6 vT- The excesses and savings in our budget grants anticipated after the final review have to be telegraphed to Bushire on the 5th Feb. The revised grants (as per p.u.c.16), total expenses up to the end of January, 1946 and anticipated expenses for February and March 46 are given in the statement placed below: f It is considered that the following additional amounts will be necessary:- Rs. 1900/- U 31 A C.3. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in chronological order from the front to the back of the file, and terminates with a set of notes at folios 56-61. Circled serial numbers in ink, which occur throughout the file (red for incoming, blue/black for outgoing correspondence), refer to entries in the notes.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 62; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-53; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains the statement of budget estimates for the Political Agency, Bahrain for the financial year 1945-46, and associated financial statements and correspondence for the same period.The correspondence is mainly between staff of the Political Agency, Bahrain, and the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf. There is also some correspondence with the Political Officer, Trucial Coast (POTC); and the Residency Agent, Sharjah.The budget estimates cover expenditure on pay of officers; pay of establishment; allowances, honoraria etc.; secret expenditure; and other charges. Also included are detailed pay statements for officers and establishment; statements of 'K-Special War Charges'; statements of fixed and contract grants; statements of anticipated excesses and savings; and statements of modifications.The correspondence consists of covering letters, and correspondence concerning particular items of expenditure. The latter particularly concerns the maintenance grant for the truck supplied to the Political Officer, Trucial Coast, December 1945 - August 1946.The date range gives the covering dates for the main items of correspondence; the earliest and latest dated additions to the file are entries in the notes dated 25 June 1944 and 15 June 1947.
